title: John-Batchelor-glitchy-f-35-satellite-repair.mp3
description:
Robots Rising: ALIS of the Glitchy F-35. Modular Satellite Repair. Hypersonic Drones. Patrick Tucker, Defense One.

John Batchelor april 19,2016 podcast

MP3

â€œProblems with the Joint Strike Fighterâ€™s logistics software will not keep the F-35 fleet from flying, the Pentagon says, contrary to a new Government Accountability Office, or GAO, report that hinted at a possible grounding.

â€œIn the April 14 report, GAO officials say problems with one of the jet fighterâ€™s software suites are so severe that â€œit could take the entire F-35 fleet offlineâ€ if there was a failure, in part because thereâ€™s no backup to the system.

â€œEarlier this year, F-35 program chief Air Force Lt. Gen. Chris Bogdan told reporters that the plane could fly without the $16.7 billion Autonomic Logistics Information System, or ALIS, for at least 30 days. The software, which runs on ground computers, not the plane itself, manages the aircraftâ€™s supply chain, aircraft configuration, fault diagnostics, mission planning and debriefing â€” none of which are critical to combat flight.

â€œAsked whether the problems cited in the GAO report were severe enough to ground the fleet, a Defense Department official involved in the program and speaking on condition of anonymity, matter-of-factly said â€œno.â€...
